actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.

official_title: To amend title 18, United States Code, with respect to the use and sale of military medals and decorations.

summary.text: Amends the Federal criminal code to delete the $250 cap on the maximum fine for the unauthorized wearing, manufacturing, or selling of military decorations or medals. Specifies that if the decoration or medal involved in the offense is a Congressional Medal of Honor the offender shall be fined or imprisoned for not more than one year, or both. Includes as sales, with respect to a Congressional Medal of Honor, trades, barters, or exchanges for anything of value.

titles.title: To amend title 18, United States Code, with respect to the use and sale of military medals and decorations.
